page.title: 03Ecology
page.content: Many lanes and footpaths give access to woods, fields and small natural areas of great beauty. Many birds, butterflies, small animals such as rabbits and squirrels and wild flowers can be seen.Several woods are carpeted with bluebells in Spring.Unfortunately Dutch Elm Disease has destroyed the Elm trees but many other varieties of tree, mainly deciduous, provide areas of attractive woodlands.A tree preservation order has been placed on Clay Pit Rough after the removal of woodland to increase arable land. At Hill Hook the old Mill Pool,all that remains of a large open area which is now a housing estate,is a Nature Conservation area; the pool has been restored,the old mill wheel will be replaced and seats are being provided so that people can enjoy the picturesque lake with its wild life.
